image.altText: A boy and his dad smiling together while on a mountain.

props.synopsis: An investigation has found 18 staff inappropriately accessed the records of a patient who died after a hit and run crash last year, understood to be the son of the state's police commissioner.

title.children: 18 SA Health staff inappropriately accessed Charlie Stevens' medical record

image.altText: South Australia's Treasurer Stephen Mullighan.

props.synopsis: South Australia's government has reported a mid-year surplus, but the state's Treasurer says there won't be more big spends like the Torrens to Darlington and Women's and Children's Hospital projects until they are completed.

title.children: SA debt grows due to infrastructure and health, despite mid-year surplus

image.altText: Kay Lawrence smiles, she has grey hair. Wears dark rimmed glasses and weaves threads together with her hands

props.synopsis: Women's suffrage was the work of many hands, and two tapestries that celebrate Australia's part in that story, and that were woven by more than 1,000 members of the public, are in pride of place at a new exhibition.

title.children: The story of women's suffrage was partly woven in SA, and is told in two tapestries

image.altText: The first steel slab produced using hydrogen instead of coal and coke

props.synopsis: Western Australia emerges as Australia's newest steelmaking state after securing a groundbreaking green iron pilot plant ahead of New South Wales and South Australia.

title.children: 'Home of steel making' faces uncertain future after WA wins green iron pilot

image.altText: Lisa Lines smiles as she sits behind a desk with her hands clasped together

props.synopsis: An Adelaide magistrate has ruled that a woman charged with plotting to murder her ex-partner will have to prove her innocence in court, despite her arguing there isn't enough evidence to convict her of the crime.

title.children: Woman loses bid to have attempted axe murder charge thrown out of court

image.altText: A baby on white sheets wearing pink

props.synopsis: South Australia's deputy coroner has described police evidence at an inquest into the death of a baby killed by her father at a reservoir as "capable of being read as victim-blaming", but the lawyer representing police has rejected that claim, saying the force understood the girl's mother "was under a level of coercive control".

title.children: Police evidence described as 'victim-blaming' at inquest into killing of baby by father at SA reservoir

image.altText: An ancient axe next to a ruler

props.synopsis: A South Australian teacher who collected hundreds of objects starting in the 1960s is now trying to sell them, but Indigenous leaders say they should instead be put on display in a "keeping place" that doesn't yet exist.

title.children: Sale of large collection of South Australian Aboriginal artefacts opposed

image.altText: daughter holding photo

props.synopsis: Sonja Kurtzer was a "trailblazing feminist" who inevitably lost her identity in an attempt to seek "spiritual healing". Now, her daughter Ellen Bertani is on a quest for justice.

title.children: Ellen's mum sought 'spiritual healing', then stopped counselling and medication

image.altText: A car splashes water as it drives over a wet road

props.synopsis: After days of heavy rain in Queensland's south-east, the north is now copping a soaking amid warnings of thunderstorms and possible flash floods.

title.children: Queenslanders bracing for big wet amid warnings of severe thunderstorms and flash flooding

image.altText: A close up of hand holding a fuel pump at the bowser

props.synopsis: Fuel prices are set to rise in multiple major cities over the festive season, according to the peak body for motoring and travel.

title.children: Fuel prices to increase in most cities ahead of Christmas, peak motoring body says

image.altText: Vladimir Putin, at a press conference, holding his hand up to his head like a telephone.

props.synopsis: The Russian president says "the other side" of negotiations will need to compromise to bring an end to the Ukraine war.

title.children: Putin says he's ready to 'negotiate and compromise' with Trump on Ukraine

image.altText: Jacob and Helen smile at the camera while Helen puts her arm around her son

props.synopsis: A specialised dental service is helping to fill a big cavity in an industry that has been largely inaccessible for people with disability. For Jacob, 20, it has been life changing.

title.children: For people living with disability, accessing a dentist can be a challenge

image.altText: The sign outside the South Australian Coroners Court.

props.synopsis: The South Australian Supreme Court has quashed a certificate giving a former SA Health employee immunity during an inquest into three ramping deaths.

title.children: Doctor loses immunity over ramping inquest evidence

image.altText: A man with light brown hair wearing a blue shirt

props.synopsis: A "predatory" photographer who committed child sex offences has been slammed by his victims in court and labelled a "monster" who ruined their lives. Warning: This story contains details readers may find confronting.

title.children: Adelaide photographer who sexually abused kids labelled 'monster' in court

image.altText: people on platform with trains.

props.synopsis: Already 52 services have been affected, and passengers are being warned to expect more delays and cancellations across the Sydney Trains, Intercity and NSW Trainlink network.

title.children: Sydney train chaos threatens NYE fireworks, police commissioner says

image.altText: Two women stand waist deep in water at a beach.

props.synopsis: People are warned against swimming at many of Hobart's beaches after industrial waste from the Cadbury chocolate factory takes a treatment plant offline, leading to untreated sewage flowing into the River Derwent.

title.children: Hobart beaches contaminated after Cadbury chocolate factory knocks out sewage plant

image.altText: A sign for King Island Dairy out the front of the company.

props.synopsis: King Island's faced some tough times lately, with its iconic dairy set to close, a drought, and uncertainty over its mine's future.

title.children: King Island locals say they're left without an 'economic backbone' after dairy shuts

image.altText: Fani Willis, wearing a pink blouse and pearl necklace, sits in a court dock.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for Trump successfully argued Fani Willis, a Democrat district attorney in Georgia, should be disqualified from the case after she had a relationship with a lawyer she hired to lead it.

title.children: A secret love affair sank a prosecutor's chance to take down Trump

image.altText: A woman wearing a sari and sunglasses smiles while shaking hands with a man in Indian attire

props.synopsis: Muslim-majority Bangladesh and Hindu-majority India enjoyed close relations for decades. That changed in 2024.

title.children: A political 'husband-wife' relationship has ended badly in South Asia

image.altText: A court sketch shows a three people sstanding before the court and a man (the accused) in the middle in a black suit.

props.synopsis: Accused CEO killer Luigi Mangione has been charged with new federal charges of stalking and murder by firearm, the latter which could bring the possibility of the death penalty if he is convicted.

title.children: Luigi Mangione could face death penalty under new federal charges

image.altText: A screenshot of a false news story about payments ith the words "dodgy website" stamped over it in red

props.synopsis: These websites might seem like victimless enterprises, but there are real-world consequences for people who get tangled up in the lies.

title.children: Scammers exploit Google to lure victims through Centrelink payment rumour

image.altText: Several Palestinians looking through the bombed out interior of an apartment, seen through a destroyed building fascade.

props.synopsis: US and Arab mediators are working around the clock to hammer out a ceasefire deal between the Israeli government and terror group Hamas.

title.children: Israeli strikes kill 41 in Gaza as truce talks with Hamas continue

image.altText: A generic photo of ASX board.

props.synopsis: Australian shares fall further, adding to Thursday's $50 billion in losses. Global markets remain under pressure, despite the Dow Jones snapping its losing streak. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX down more than 1pc, on track for worst monthly fall in two years

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Shoppers will spend almost $70b in lead up to Christmas: Roy Morgan
The ASX is now trading at a 3-month low
Bill Shorten is slamming AGL over the Centrepay scandal

image.altText: A young woman with long blonde hair smiles, sitting on the ground surrounded by pots of colourful flowers.

props.synopsis: Jasmine Waddington had envisioned her life revolving around sports before a medical condition greatly restricted her physical abilities at the age of 15. But she's found a new career path, thanks to her grandmother.

title.children: Woman discovers pigface passion after life 'completely changed' by POTS diagnosis

image.altText: The Princess of Wales and her family sit smiling at the camera in a rural setting with green trees in the background

props.synopsis: The holiday card's image may look familiar to fans, since it's a still from the video in which Kate announced the end of her chemotherapy treatment.

title.children: Prince William and Kate release poignant Christmas card after 'brutal' year

image.altText: A thick plume of smoke and red hazy sky

props.synopsis: Bushfires prompt tourist cancellations for Victoria's Grampians National Park as people abandon Christmas holiday plans.

title.children: Caravan park considers closing as fire continues to burn in The Grampians

image.altText: Michael Leunig faces a microphone in a radio studio, wearing a concerned expression.

props.synopsis: Australian cartoonist, poet and writer Michael Leunig has died aged 79 in the early hours of Thursday morning.

title.children: 'Pretty huge': Colleagues mourn cartoonist Michael Leunig

image.altText: Moira Deeming walking with a folder in her hand.

props.synopsis: A rift in the Victorian Liberals has been laid bare after a narrow vote at Parliament House saw MPs vote against readmitting ousted MP Moira Deeming to the party's parliamentary ranks.

title.children: Deeming backers 'flabbergasted' as split vote confirms MP's exile

image.altText: Australian travellers boarding a large aircraft.

props.synopsis: Hundreds more Australians stranded in Vanuatu after devastating earthquakes have been flown back home on RAAF flights this evening, with the first plane touching down at 6pm.

title.children: More Australians stranded in earthquake-stricken Vanuatu fly home with RAAF

image.altText: Ness stands with arms at her side, seen from the waist up, looking straight at the camera in front of green reeds and plants

props.synopsis: Australians living with deafblindness can be at increased risk of developing mental health issues, but as Vanessa Vlajkovic discovered, communication issues and a lack of understanding make it difficult for them to get meaningful help.

title.children: I have BPD, and being deafblind made it harder to get help

props.synopsis: A collection of long-lost stories and illustrations have been celebrated in the Wangka Walytja exhibition in Papunya, paying tribute to the radical bilingual literature movement of the 1970s.

title.children: Ancient stories and priceless illustrations of first contact uncovered in exhibition

image.altText: A bee hive with honeycomb and bees everywhere.

props.synopsis: Beekeepers in Victoria are being kept busy as hives swarm in warm weather. On one job, the side of a farmhouse was "vibrating" with activity when beekeepers arrived to remove a 50-year-old hive.

title.children: Massive hive in wall takes beekeepers three days to remove

image.altText: A woman sneezing into a tissue in a field of flowers

props.synopsis: Some Australians say their hay fever and allergies have been so bad they've been forced to relocate. So what can you do to better adapt to environments with high levels of pollen?

title.children: Moving states could be the answer to your hay fever

props.synopsis: Hailing from London with Jamaican heritage, Melissa Warren wants to challenge perceptions of sailing and pave the way for more people of colour to participate in the sport.

title.children: The 'powerful message' Melissa Warren will send when she sails the Sydney to Hobart
